reviewText: The movies themselves are all excellent movies. I have seen them all, some more than once. However, the discs I received play fine but if you pause or stop play they send you back to the beginning and you have to fast forward back to where you left off. How annoying is that. Plenty.

Great value

Exactly what I expected as far as the Blu-Rays are concerned.  However, the UltraViolet codes provided for the HD digital copies are only redeemable in the UK and Ireland.  I didn't expect this, since the Blu-Rays were region-free, but maybe that is normal.  Regardless, one of the big reasons I purchased this set was to have both the Blu-Ray and the digital copy, and now I'm out of luck for the digital copies.  If I had known that ahead of time, I may have purchased just the digital copy from Google Play, Vudu, or similar.

So for anyone not in the UK or Ireland, do not expect to be able to redeem the UV codes for digital copies, otherwise, enjoy the movies!

If you're looking at this boxed set, I assume you already know whether you want to buy seven "Fast and Furious" movies at one stroke. (If you really don't, here's the quiz: do you like hot cars, wild action, and Vin Diesel? If so, you'll enjoy these movies.) So for this review, I'm going to be addressing the qualities of the packaging of this set.

When it comes to boxed collections of these movies, up until just recently you basically had two choices: this, or the Ultimate Ride Collection. A new 8-movie boxed set, seemingly similar to this one with the most recent film, has since been released; Im going to go ahead and post this just for the record. I settled on this box because so many reviews of the Ultimate Ride Collection, on Amazon and elsewhere, complained about scratched or unplayable discs.

I'm happy to say that the packaging on the 7-Movie Collection is very good. The plastic box containing the discs is housed in a cardboard slipcase of its own. The cardboard box has some raised bumps on the front that give it a pleasant texture, but you could certainly get rid of it if you don't feel like having to slide your collection out of an additional piece of packaging every time you want to get at your movies.

The plastic case itself feels solid and has a good heft. Inside, the discs are mounted on a series of plastic flaps, one on each side of each flap. I think this should be the standard for boxed sets like this; putting a plie of discs on a single spindle is a sin and one that's thankfully avoided here. As a result, all of the discs in my set were in good shape.

The discs here (I've got the Blu-ray version, but I assume it's the same with the DVDs) are identical to the individual releases. Theres also a DVD (not Blu-ray, even in the BD version of the collection) that includes extra materialbut not having watched it yet, I cant speak to whats on it. Overall, this is (or perhaps was) a good way to grab these films.

~

Great movies, but Furious 7 doesn't want to play. It tries to download previews and force you to watch them, but instead just goes to a black screen. When I finally got it to play by disabling the internet connection on my Playstation (under Settings), it turns out the movie skips at 20:39, making an important expository scene unwatchable. It may skip more; I'm writing this in frustration while watching the movie. It figures that they'd cheap out on disc 7, as it takes most people long enough to get to it that they can no longer get their money back, which they by rights should.

I was going to try to return it, but I guess it's been too long. This would've been a great collection, if all the discs would play. I just now, six weeks later, have gotten to the last movie in the collection, and it won't play. And I guess six weeks is too long to return it. I don't want to return it. I just want a copy of Fast and Furious 7. All the other discs worked just fine. All other blu ray discs seem to work fine in my player. This sucks. So one star. I'll try calling Amazon when I have more time. If it goes well, I'll change this review.

P.S., great movies. Love this series. Can't wait for F8!

This review is for the 7-disk Bluray set, not the movies themselves.  (The movies are excellent!)  Although the hard-copy bluray set worked just fine, the downloadable Digital Copy did not.  As part of the disk set, I was given a leaflet with 7 codes to download each film individually from Utraviolet.  After entering the first one, the website informed me that I must reside in Ireland or the UK to download them.
Unfortunately this is not disclosed in the item description on Amazon.  The product name references the DIGITAL HD copy as part of the item, and in the details it it referenced as compatible for "all regions".  That may be true for the hard-copy disks.  But it is not true for the digital copies.

This is a great deal for those looking to pick up the full Fast & Furious set at a modest price and in compact packaging. All the discs are stored in a single jumbo style blu-ray case which slides into an attractively embossed slip cover. All seven movies are on separate, easily accessible blu-ray discs with an eighth (standard DVD) disc containing special features.

If you're looking for an economical way to add the complete Fast & Furious franchise to your collection, you can't go wrong with this set. The packaging is sharp and compact and the price is right. I'm sure this'll be reissued when an eighth movie eventually rolls of the line, but until then, this is the best way to inject a bit of NOS into your blu-ray collection.

I used to be one of those fools that would make fun of the fast and furious franchise. I would see a trailer for the next F&F movie and think, "How can there be another one? These are so dumb! Who watches this garbage?" Boy, was I wrong. My wife and I decided one day that we would watch some of the movies just to have a laugh and to our surprise we realized that they weren't trash at all and in fact they were totally awesome. We were converted. We binge watched all 6 movies and then went to seven in the theater and loved them all. Well, to be honest Tokyo drift was weird, but the rest, pure entertainment gold. They have everything you could want from a movie. High speed action, explosions, awesome cars including one that can pop a wheelie on command. It's got The Rock exploding a cast off of his arm by flexing, lots of fighting, beautiful women and men inside of beautiful cars driving in beautiful places like out of buildings or off cliffs or Rio just to name a few. Do yourself a favor and watch these movies. You won't regret it.

Contacted amazon and they sent me a replacement... this time I inspected each dvd and although not cracked "fast five" had a scratch and smudges all over it. I don't like shipping damaged products back hopefully I can make it through without skipping.
Very pleased with the service and product.
